name: lib/color-contrast-calc.js
ColorContrastCalc
description: Provides the top-level name space of this library.

name: colorFrom
description:
Returns an instance of Color.

As colorValue, you can pass a predefined color name, or an RGB
value represented as an array of Integers or a hex code such as
[255, 255, 255] or "#ffff00". name is assigned to the returned
instance if it does not have a name already assigned.

unknown.tagValue: {Color} Instance of Color

params.name: colorValue
params.description:
name
    of a predefined color or RGB value

params.name: name
params.description:
Unless the instance has predefined name,
    the name passed to the method is set to self.name

return.description: Instance of Color

name: colorsWithSufficientContrast
description:
Returns an array of named colors that satisfy a given level of
contrast ratio

unknown.tagValue: {Color[]}

params.name: color
params.description: base color to which other colors are compared

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

name: hslColors
description:
Returns an array of colors which share the same saturation and lightness.
By default, so-called pure colors are returned.

unknown.tagValue: {Color[]}

params.name: s
params.description: Ratio of saturation in percentage.

params.name: l
params.description: Ratio of lightness in percentage.

params.name: h_interval
params.description:
Interval of hues given in degrees.
    By default, it returns 360 hues beginning from red.
    (Red is included twice, because it corresponds to 0 and 360 degrees.)

name: compareFunction
description: Returns a function to be used as a parameter of Array.prototype.sort()

unknown.tagValue: {function} Function that compares given two colors

params.name: colorOrder
params.description:
A left side primary color has a higher
    sorting precedence

params.name: keyType
params.description:
Type of keys used for sorting:
    "color", "hex" or "rgb"

params.name: keyMapper
params.description:
A function used to retrive key values
    from elements to be sorted

return.description: Function that compares given two colors

name: sort
description: Sorts colors in an array and returns the result as a new array

unknown.tagValue: {Color[]} An array of sorted colors

params.name: colors
params.description: List of colors

params.name: colorOrder
params.description:
A left side primary color has a higher
    sorting precedence, and an uppercase letter means descending order

params.name: keyMapper
params.description:
A function used to retrive key values
    from elements to be sorted

params.name: mode
params.description:
If set to "hex", key values are handled as
    hex code strings

return.description: An array of sorted colors

name: NAMED_COLORS
description:
Array of named colors defined at
https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/types.html#ColorKeywords

name: WEB_SAFE_COLORS
description: Array of web safe colors

name: lib/color-utils.js
ColorUtils
description:
Collection of functions that provide basic operations on colors
represented as RGB/HSL value (given in the form of array of numbers)
or hex code (given in the form of string)

name: hexCodeToRgb
description: Converts a hex color code string to a decimal representation

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} RGB value represented as
    an array of numbers

params.name: hexCode
params.description: Hex color code such as "#ffff00"

return.description:
RGB value represented as
    an array of numbers

name: normalizeHexCode
description: Converts a hex color code to a 6-digit hexadecimal string

unknown.tagValue: {string} 6-digit hexadecimal string with/without leading '#'

params.name: hexString
params.description: String that represent a hex code

params.name: prefix
params.description:
Append '#' to the head of return value
    if a truthy value is given

return.description: 6-digit hexadecimal string with/without leading '#'

name: rgbToHexCode
description: Converts a decimal representation of color to a hex code string

unknown.tagValue: {string} RGB value in hex code

params.name: rgb
params.description:
RGB value represented as
    an array of numbers

return.description: RGB value in hex code

name: hslToRgb
description: Converts HSL value to RGB value

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} An array of numbers that
    represents RGB value

params.name: hsl
params.description:
An array of numbers that
    represents HSL value

return.description:
An array of numbers that
    represents RGB value

name: hslToHexCode
description: Converts HSL value to hex code

unknown.tagValue: {string} Hex code

params.name: hsl
params.description:
An array of numbers that
    represents HSL value

return.description: Hex code

name: rgbToHsl
description: Converts RGB value to HSL value

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} An array of numbers that
    represents HSL value

params.name: rgb
params.description:
An array of numbers that
    represents RGB value

return.description:
An array of numbers that
    represents HSL value

name: hexCodeToHsl
description: Converts a hex color code string to an HSL representation

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} HSL value represented as
    an array of numbers

params.name: hexCode
params.description: Hex color code such as "#ffff00"

return.description:
HSL value represented as
    an array of numbers

name: decimalRound
description: Decimal rounding with a given precision

unknown.tagValue: {number} returns the rounded number

params.name: number
params.description: Number to be rounded off

params.name: precision
params.description: Number of digits after the decimal point

return.description: returns the rounded number

name: isValidRgb
description: Checks if a given array is a valid representation of RGB color.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} true if the argument is a valid RGB color

params.name: rgb
params.description:
RGB value represented as
    an array of numbers

return.description: true if the argument is a valid RGB color

name: isValidHsl
description: Checks if a given array is a valid representation of HSL color.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} true if the argument is a valid HSL color

params.name: hsl
params.description:
HSL value represented as
    an array of numbers

return.description: true if the argument is a valid HSL color

name: isValidHexCode
description: Checks if a given string is a valid representation of RGB color.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} returns true if then argument is a valid RGB color

params.name: code
params.description: RGB value in hex code

return.description: returns true if then argument is a valid RGB color

name: isSameHexColor
description: Checks if given two hex color codes represent a same color.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if given two colors are same

params.name: hexCode1
params.description:
Color given as a hex code,
    such as "#ffff00", "#FFFF00" or "#ff0"

params.name: hexCode2
params.description:
Color given as a hex code,
    such as "#ffff00", "#FFFF00" or "#ff0"

return.description: True if given two colors are same

name: isSameRgbColor
description: Checks if given two RGB values represent a same color.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if given two colors are same

params.name: rgb1
params.description:
Color given as an array
    of numbers, such as [255, 255, 0]

params.name: rgb2
params.description:
Color given as an array
    of numbers, such as [255, 255, 0]

return.description: True if given two colors are same

name: isString
description: Checks if a given object is a string

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} returns true if the argument is a string

params.name: str
params.description: Object to be checked

return.description: returns true if the argument is a string

name: isUpperCase
description: Checks if a given string is consists of uppercase letters

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} returns true if letters in the argument string are
    all uppercase

params.name: str
params.description: string to be checked

return.description:
returns true if letters in the argument string are
    all uppercase

name: lib/color.js
NAMED_COLORS
description:
Array of named colors defined at
https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/types.html#ColorKeywords

name: hslColors
description:
Returns an array of colors which share the same saturation and lightness.
By default, so-called pure colors are returned.

unknown.tagValue: {Color[]}

params.name: s
params.description: Ratio of saturation in percentage.

params.name: l
params.description: Ratio of lightness in percentage.

params.name: h_interval
params.description:
Interval of hues given in degrees.
    By default, it returns 360 hues beginning from red.
    (Red is included twice, because it corresponds to 0 and 360 degrees.)

name: WEB_SAFE_COLORS
description: Array of web safe colors

name: Color
description:
Class of which each instance represents a specific color.
The instances provide methods to generate a new color with modified
properties, such as lightness or saturation.

name: getByName
description: Returns an instance of Color for a predefined color name.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: name
params.description:
names are defined at
    https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/types.html#ColorKeywords

name: getByHexCode
description: Returns an instance of Color for a hex code

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: code
params.description: RGB value in hex code

name: newHslColor
description: Creates an instance of Color from an HSL value

unknown.tagValue: {Color} An instance of Color

params.name: hsl
params.description:
an array of numbers that
    represents an HSL value

return.description: An instance of Color

params.name: rgb
params.description:
RGB value
    represented as a string (hex code) or an array of numbers

params.name: name
params.description:
the value of this.name: if null,
    the value of this.hexCode is set to this.name instead

properties.name: rgb
properties.description:
RGB value repsented as
    an array of decimal numbers

properties.name: relativeLuminance
properties.description:
Relative luminance of  the color
    defined at
    https://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#relativeluminancedef

properties.name: name
properties.description:
If no name is explicitely given, the property
    is set to the value of this.hexCode

properties.name: hexCode
properties.description: RGB value in hex code notation

properties.name: hsl
properties.description:
HSL value repsented as
    an array of decimal numbers

name: contrastRatioAgainst
description: Calculate the contrast ratio against another color

unknown.tagValue: {number}

params.name: color
params.description:
another color
    as an instance of Color, a hex code or a RGB value

name: withContrast
description: Return a new instance of Color with adjusted contrast.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: ratio
params.description: Value in percent

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: withBrightness
description: Return a new instance of Color with adjusted brightness.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: ratio
params.description: Value in percent

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: withInvert
description: Return an inverted color as an instance of Color.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: ratio
params.description: Value in percent

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: withHueRotate
description: Return a hue rotation applied color as an instance of Color.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: degree
params.description: Value in degree

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: withSaturate
description: Return a saturated color as an instance of Color.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: ratio
params.description: Value in percent

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: withGrayscale
description: Return a grayscale of the original color.

unknown.tagValue: {Color}

params.name: ratio
params.description: Conversion ratio in percentage

params.name: name
params.description: Name of color

name: findBrightnessThreshold
description:
Tries to find a color whose contrast against the base color is close
 to a given level.

The returned color is gained by modifying the brightness of otherColor.
Even when a color that satisfies the level is not found, it returns
a new color anyway.

unknown.tagValue:
{Color} A color whose contrast against the base color is close to
    a specified level

params.name: otherColor
params.description: The color before the modification of brightness

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

return.description:
A color whose contrast against the base color is close to
    a specified level

name: findLightnessThreshold
description:
Tries to find a color whose contrast against the base color is close to
a given level.

The returned color is gained by modifying the lightness of otherColor.
Even when a color that satisfies the level is not found, it returns
a new color anyway.

unknown.tagValue:
{Color} A color whose contrast against the base color is close to
    a specified level

params.name: otherColor
params.description: The color before the modification of lightness

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

return.description:
A color whose contrast against the base color is close to
    a specified level

unknown.tagValue:
{string} A, AA or AAA if the contrast ratio meets the criteria of
    WCAG 2.0, otherwise "-"

return.description:
A, AA or AAA if the contrast ratio meets the criteria of
    WCAG 2.0, otherwise "-"

name: hasSufficientContrast
description:
Checks if the contrast ratio between the base color and otherColor meets
the requirement of WCAG 2.0

unknown.tagValue: {boolean}

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

name: isSameColor
description: Checks if the base color and otherColor have the same RGB value

unknown.tagValue: {boolean}
{boolean} true if each primary color of the base color is 0 or 255

return.description: true if each primary color of the base color is 0 or 255

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} true if the hex code of the color is #808080

return.description: true if the hex code of the color is #808080

name: toString
description:
Returns a string representation of the color.
When 16 is passed, it return the hex code, and when 10 is passed,
it returns the value in RGB notation
Otherwise, it returns the color name or the hex code

unknown.tagValue: {string}

params.name: base
params.description: 16, 10 or null

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} true if the relative luminance of the base color is
    greater than that of otherColor

return.description:
true if the relative luminance of the base color is
    greater than that of otherColor

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} true if the relative luminance of the base color is
    equal to that of otherColor

return.description:
true if the relative luminance of the base color is
    equal to that of otherColor

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} true if the contrast ratio against white is qual to or
    less than the ratio against black

return.description:
true if the contrast ratio against white is qual to or
    less than the ratio against black

name: lib/contrast-checker.js
ContrastChecker
description: Collection of functions that check properties of given colors

name: relativeLuminance
description:
Calculate the relative luminance of a RGB color given as a string or
an array of numbers

unknown.tagValue: {number} Relative luminance

params.name: rgb
params.description:
RGB value represented
    as a string (hex code) or an array of numbers

return.description: Relative luminance

name: contrastRatio
description: Calculate the contrast ratio of given colors

unknown.tagValue: {number} Contrast ratio

params.name: foreground
params.description:
RGB value
    represented as a string (hex code) or an array of numbers

params.name: background
params.description:
RGB value
    represented as a string (hex code) or an array of numbers

return.description: Contrast ratio

name: ratioToLevel
description: Rate a given contrast ratio according to the WCAG 2.0 criteria

unknown.tagValue:
{string} A, AA or AAA if the contrast ratio meets the criteria of
    WCAG 2.0, otherwise "-"

params.name: ratio
params.description: Contrast ratio

return.description:
A, AA or AAA if the contrast ratio meets the criteria of
    WCAG 2.0, otherwise "-"

name: isLightColor
description:
Check if the contrast ratio of a given color against black is higher
than against white.

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} true if the contrast ratio against white is qual to or
    less than the ratio against black

params.name: color
params.description:
RGB value
    represented as a string (hex code) or an array of numbers

return.description:
true if the contrast ratio against white is qual to or
    less than the ratio against black

name: lib/threshold-finder.js
find
description:
Tries to find a color whose contrast against the base color is close to
a given level.

The returned color is gained by modifying the lightness of otherRgb.
Even when a color that satisfies the level is not found, it returns
a new color anyway.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} RGB value of a new color whose
    contrast ratio against fixedRgb is close to a specified level

params.name: fixedRgb
params.description:
RGB value which remains
    unchanged

params.name: otherRgb
params.description:
RGB value before the
    modification of lightness

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

return.description:
RGB value of a new color whose
    contrast ratio against fixedRgb is close to a specified level

name: find
description:
Tries to find a color whose contrast against the base color is close
 to a given level.

The returned color is gained by modifying the brightness of otherRgb.
Even when a color that satisfies the level is not found, it returns
a new color anyway.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array<number, number, number>} RGB value of a new color whose
    contrast ratio against fixedRgb is close to a specified level

params.name: fixedRgb
params.description:
RGB value which remains
    unchanged

params.name: otherRgb
params.description:
RGB value before the
    modification of brightness

params.name: level
params.description: A, AA or AAA

return.description:
RGB value of a new color whose
    contrast ratio against fixedRgb is close to a specified level

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "color-contrast-calc",
  "version": "0.4.0",
  "description": "Utility that helps you choose colors with sufficient contrast, WCAG 2.0 in mind",
  "homepage": "https://github.com/nico-hn/color-contrast-calc",
  "main": "index.js",
  "author": "HASHIMOTO, Naoki",
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "mocha",
    "lint": "eslint *.js lib/*.js test/*.js"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/nico-hn/color-contrast-calc.git"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-plugin-transform-runtime": "^6.23.0",
    "babel-polyfill": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-preset-env": "^1.6.1",
    "babelify": "^8.0.0",
    "browserify": "^16.2.0",
    "chai": "^4.1.2",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^4.19.1",
    "gulp": "^3.9.1",
    "gulp-babel": "^7.0.1",
    "gulp-cli": "^2.0.1",
    "mocha": "^5.1.1",
    "sinon": "^4.5.0",
    "vinyl-source-stream": "^2.0.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
